title.narrative: Haiti Sustainable Rural and Small Towns Water and Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The proposed objectives of the Project are to: (i) increase access to improved water supply and sanitation in targeted rural areas and small towns in zones affected by cholera; (ii) strengthen the Recipient’s water and sanitation service delivery mechanism at thedeconcentrated level; and (iii) improve the Recipient’s capacity to respond promptly and effectively to an Eligible Emergency.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Economy and Finance, MEF

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :DINEPA Subsidiary Agreement (Schedule 2, Section I.B.1) | Description :To facilitate the carrying out of theProject, the Recipient shall make the proceeds of the Financing available to DINEPA under a Subsidiary Agreement between theRecipient, acting through the MTPTC and the MEF, and DINEPA, under terms and conditions approved by the Association.

Finance Agreement :DINEPA Subsidiary Agreement (Schedule 2, Section I.B.1) | Description :To facilitate the carrying out of theProject, the Recipient shall make the proceeds of the Financing available to DINEPA under an amended Subsidiary Agreement betweenthe Recipient, acting through the MTPTC and the MEF, and DINEPA, under terms and conditions approved by the Association. | Due Date:31-Oct-2017

Finance Agreement :Financial Management, Financial Reports and Audits (Schedule 2, Section II.B.4) | Description :The Recipientshall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date recruit an external auditor based on terms of reference acceptable tothe Association to carry out the annual audit.

Finance Agreement :Financial Management, Financial Reports and Audits (Schedule 2, Section II.B.4) | Description :The Recipientshall not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date recruit an external auditor based on terms of reference acceptable tothe Association to carry out the annual audits of such Financial Statements referred to in Section 4.09(b) of the GeneralConditions. | Due Date :30-Apr-2018

Finance Agreement :Safeguards (Schedule 2, Section I.G.1) | Description :No later than six (6) months from the date of thisAgreement, and in any case prior to the carrying out of any works under the Project, the Recipient shall and shall cause DINEPA toadopt the ESMF and the RPF in a manner satisfactory to the Association.

Finance Agreement :Safeguards (Schedule 2, Section I.G.2) | Description :Prior to the carrying out of any works under the Project,the Recipient shall cause DINEPA to, as applicable, prepare plans for environmental management or resettlement, acceptable to theAssociation, all in accordance with the ESMF and the RPF. | Due Date :31-Oct-2017

Finance Agreement :Safeguards (Schedule 2, Section I.G.2) | Description :Prior to the carrying out of any works under the Project,the Recipient shall cause DINEPA to: (i) carry out an environmental and social screening and assessment of the proposed activities;(ii) carry out a resettlement screening and assessment of the proposed activities, if need be. | Due Date :31-Oct-2017

Finance Agreement :Safeguards (Schedule 2, Section I.G.3) | Description :Prior to the carrying out of any works under the Project,the Recipient shall cause DINEPA to (i) carry out an environmental and social screening and assessment of the proposed activities;(ii) exclude from the Project any activities requiring physical relocation of people; and (iii) as applicable, prepare a plan forland acquisition acceptable to the Association, all in accordance with the RPF.

Finance Agreement :Sub-Grants (Schedule 2, Section I.D.1) | Description :For purposes of carrying out Part 1 (c) (iii) of theProject and upon the selection of an OP, the Recipient shall cause DINEPA to enter into a Sub-grant Agreement with the OP inaccordance with criteria and procedures acceptable to the Association, as set forth in the Project Operations Manual, and underterms and conditions acceptable to the Association.

Finance Agreement :Sub-Grants (Schedule 2, Section I.D.1) | Description :For purposes of carrying out Part 1 (c)(iii) of theProject, the Recipient shall cause DINEPA to: (i) select an OP in accordance with criteria and procedures acceptable to theAssociation, as set forth in the Project Operations Manual; and thereafter (ii) enter into a Sub-grant Agreement with the selectedOP under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-Oct-2017

title.narrative: Number of OREPAs among the 4 existing ones that have installed an accounting system which facilitates the consolidation of financial information at the central level.
Departments covered by WSS baseline information
Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project
CAEPAs that include at least 20 percent female representation in project area
Students and teachers benefitting from improved sanitation facilities in public schools under the project
Piped water systems managed sustainably by a Professional Operator (PO) under the project
People in rural areas provided with access to "improved sanitation facilities" - female
Number of OREPAs among the 4 existing ones, using the baseline developed under the project to prioritize.
Communities where DINEPA and MSPP local structures have jointly been trained or collaborated in water supply, hygiene promotion andsanitation themes and activities
Project beneficiaries in localities on the border with the DR including bi-national markets
Households with latrine built during project implementation and of which use is verified
People provided with access to "improved sanitation facilities” under the proj.
New piped household water connections that are resulting from the project intervention
A national programming mechanism for deconcentrated WSS service delivery is operationalized, as evidenced by tools in place
Latrine blocks for public institutions or spaces constructed or rehabilitated with management and maintenance arrangements in placeunder the project
Number of people in rural areas and small towns provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project
Required functions deconcentrated to targeted OREPA
Priority cholera communes targeted under the project
Number of people provided with access to improved water sources under the project except in the areas affected by Hurricane Matthew
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits addressed (%)
DINEPA conducts an annual joint Government/ partners sector review
A fecal sludge management service chain for rural areas and small towns is defined
DINEPA's system in place to respond to major emergencies
Latrine blocks for public institutions or spaces constructed or rehabilitated with management and maintenance arrangements in placein zones affected by Hurricane Matthew
People benefitting from consolidation work (small repairs and expansions) in zones affected by Hurricane Matthew
Number of people in rural areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources in zones affected by Hurricane Matthew
DINEPA acknowledged a gender action plan
People trained to improve hygiene behavior/sanitation practices under the project
Number of handwashing facilities built in the context of COVID-19 awareness campaign
Project beneficiaries of small repairs of water systems in the context of COVID-19 emergency
Number of hospitals and health centers whose water supply system was repaired under the COVID-19 emergency
At least one OREPA has installed an accounting system which facilitates the consolidation of financial information at the central level
At least one OREPA uses the baseline developed under the Project to prioritize interventions and inform DINEPA's program budget
